com.icodici.universa.node

Class AbstractRateCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.icodici.universa.node.AbstractRateCounter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RateCounter

    public abstract class AbstractRateCounter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Limit something specifying and counting number of 'pulses' per some time slot. Limited are usages inside the slot, when the slot is done, counts starts from 0. Serialization most completely save/restore its state: time slot, pulse limit, duration and pulses left
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • AbstractRateCounter

        public AbstractRateCounter()

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public abstract void reset(int limit,
                           java.time.Duration period)
        Set the time stol to a specified period and start counting pulses. Current state os cleared.
        Parameters:
        limit - maximum puleses per slot
        period - slot duration

      • getDuration

        public abstract java.time.Duration getDuration()
        The duration set by the reset(int, Duration)
        Returns:
        Duration

      • getPulseLimit

        public abstract int getPulseLimit()
        The pulse limit set by the reset(int, Duration)
        Returns:
        limit

      • pulsesLeft

        public abstract int pulsesLeft()
        Get the number of pulses left for the current time slot. If the slot is finished, does not create a new slot.
        Returns:
        number of pulses left in the current slot. Could be negative if the limited is exceeded.

      • countPulse

        public abstract boolean countPulse()
        Register a pulse. Creates new slot now and resets counter if the current slot is finished or there is no current slot, what could happen after the reset.

        Important. A new slot must always be created with this call. The time between the end of the current slot and the first call to the countPulse() does not count.

        Returns:
        true if the limit is not exceeded after counting the pulse.
